meanings.definition: Relating to or located on the outer surface of a plant or insect.
meanings.sent1: The epicuticular layer of the leaf helps protect it from harm.
meanings.sent2: The epicuticular characteristics of the butterfly's wings make them vibrant.
meanings.sent3: The epicuticular shine on the beetle's shell caught the sunlight in a dazzling display.
meanings.sent4: The epicuticular beauty of the flower petals was unmatched in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The epicuticular texture of the tree bark felt rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: A waxy layer covering the outer surface of a plant or insect.
meanings.sent1: The epicuticular on the leaf made it shiny in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The epicuticular of the bee's wings helped repel water.
meanings.sent3: The epicuticular of the plant looked like a protective shield.
meanings.sent4: The epicuticular of the insect glistened in the morning dew.
meanings.sent5: The epicuticular layer on the fruit gave it a glossy appearance.
